dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As EVELYN SALT checks her computer screen. She’s on a DIN NAPKIN FOLDING website. Out her window: WASHINGTON DC.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (reading off screen) Fold the right side back, one third of the way down. As she does this, a NEW ANGLE and she’s unaware that TED WINTER stops outside her door, watches as she finishes th last few folds, then slides a plastic fork, spoon and kni down inside the paper napkin ‘pouch’. Very neat.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Are you doing this on company time?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Got a big dinner tonight. I want the table just... perfect.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: If the taxpayers only knew. He steps in to take a closer look. Winter is 45, every in the tough, but fair executive type. He has a briefcase-ba over his shoulder. On his way out.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I could've done a crown fold, a lily goblet. Hmmm. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I don’t really have an opinion. She pokes at it, frowns, dissatisfied.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: It’s not very sexy. Winter looks to a desk PHOTO of Salt and her man MIKE DUN He tries to comes up with something reassuring to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s utilitarian. Utilitarian is the new sexy. She looks over her shoulder at him: Huh? He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Walk me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt and Winter walk.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You leaving for the funeral?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: 4:55 out of Dulles. New York’s going to be a zoo.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: He was a pretty great guy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: The last gentleman. Public servant for forty-two years. Died in his sleep leaving a better, safer world than he found. I’d take that epitaph.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I wished I had known him. He nods, wish she had as well.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: The Maelev summit starts tomorrow. I need all those reports waiting at Camp David in the AM. Maelev arrives at one.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Did you know he made his money as a student selling Pink Floyd and Led Zeppelin bootlegs?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I’m more interested in his position on the Ukraine, the possibility of using force to redraw the map of Eastern Europe, that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you push all this paper, Ted. I’d go crazy if I did it full time. Laughing, Winter fishes out his ID as they near...

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, you’ll be back in the field in a week. Thanks for the paper pushing help by the way. Winter hands his briefcase-bag to the SECURITY GUARD at t METAL DETECTORS. Then he swipes his ID. You need to clear security to leave as well as enter.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a great dinner, Ev. Happy anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Thank you. Have a good funeral. (a beat) That didn’t come out right. TODD BOTTOMS, a young Yale graduate hurries over from the direction they just came. Flagging Winters down.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOMS
dialogues.text: Sir! Sir! (Winter looks back) We got a walk-in! A defector. Ten minutes ago. Salt gestures to the Diversified Petroleum LOGO on the wa

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I guess he’s not buying our cover.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Did you get his bona fides?

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOMS
dialogues.text: Won’t give ‘em. But he’s Russian. He’s very strange. And... He looks from Winter to Salt, back to Winter BOTTOMS (CONT’D) He wants to talk to Salt. He asked for her by name. Salt and Winter exchange a look. How odd. Winter looks a his watch.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I got twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A starker, stripped down hallway. Concrete floors. Bare fluorescents. Salt, Winter and Bottoms walk briskly along

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Is counterintelligence down here?

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOMS
dialogues.text: Peabody is, Sir. As they turn the corner, and Winter reacts.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Fucking Peabody. They stop across from PEABODY who stands sentinel-like in hall outside a door. A CIA Counterintelligence officer, h is, technically, a motherfucker. And he’s heard his intro

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: (re: door) We're in here... And I’ll take that adverb all day long. He opens the door. Winter and Bottoms enter. Salt pauses.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: It’s an adjective actually. In this case. No reaction from him. As she follows the others.

dialogues.speaker: A RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: Seated at a desk. Hair gray, head down, hands folded in front of him. A cigarette burns between two fingers, a carton on the desk. We are in the...

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Salt, Winter and Bottoms. Peabody. A SECURITY OFFICER and TWO TECHIES. One monitoring the video equipment, the other on the fMR LIQUID CRYSTAL GRAPH of the Russian's brain - heat signat blooming in its cortex. A lie detector.

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE ONE
dialogues.text: Neural scan is up. Winter looks to Salt, nods. She enters: the door on a bli so you can’t see in from the interrogation side.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Salt sits opposite the Russian. His head stays down.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: Female intelligence officers, in my experience, are usually lesbians.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Sorry we're here to talk about you. Why don’t we start with your name. He looks up. A character from a Gogol short story. Gaunt, older, pale dangerous eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN, (ZYKOV)
dialogues.text: My name is Oleg Vassily Zykov. Salt just stares at him. Hard to say what she’s thinking, but she’s thinking something. He takes drag.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Bottoms types into a computer: O-l-e-g-Z-y-k-o-v.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: He holds up the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I am moved. A defector with cancer. Are you selling secrets for chemo? Are you afraid of dying?

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Peabody likes her style. Techie two watches the scan.

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE TWO
dialogues.text: Scan says he’s truthful on the cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have gained anything by damning myself, it is that I no longer have anything to fear. Bottoms’ screen comes to life with information. Including PHOTO of Zykov maybe 7 or 8 years ago. Same guy.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOMS
dialogues.text: Oleg Zykov. He shows up in 1993 in Novosibirsk Oblast, Siberia. He was on Victor Pechyonkin’s staff there. When Pechyonkin moved to head the FSB’s Counter Terrorism Unit in ‘95, Zykov went with him. Been there ever since. Mid-level. A bureaucrat.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Prior to ‘93?

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOMS
dialogues.text: Nothing. He doesn’t exist.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Salt and Zykov.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I have someplace to be, Mr. Zykov. So if you wouldn’t mind getting to the point. (All subtitled dialog will appear as <Russian> )

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: <I came to tell you a story.>

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: <I don’t like stories. But let's hear it anyway. And please...> (in English) .--in English. Others are listening. He smiles, regards her a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: 1975. The Cold War. In a gymnasium in Grozny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WRESTLER works hard to position his OPPONENT. His body a continuous knot of muscle. His head, a brutal stub. It’ only a matter of moments as he locks in a hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Soviet Olympic wrestler named Sascha Fyorodovich Chenkov meets for the first time... His eyes, by chance, connect with those of ANJA NUREKYOVA She’s part of a group being given a tour of the facility.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...the only female chess grand master of her era, Anja Nurekyova. And Chenkov’s grip on his opponent is replaced by the magnetic intensity of his shared gaze with Nurekyova. Abruptly, his opponent breaks free and suddenly pins him. Chenkov barely notices, his eyes on hers as she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple civil ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And one year later... a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight beds all occupied. Nurekyova watches from hers as Chenkov cradles a NEWBORN child in his calloused hands. H stares at it with depthless wonder. There is no doubt thi child, in these hands, will be protected.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One year more the child was back in the same hospital, sick with fever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chenkov holds his wife as she is wracked with sobs. Tears streak his own face as well.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were told the child was dead. A body was buried. But in fact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE INFANT CHILD is carried out by a NURSE, handed throug the open back door of an idling black Volga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child lived. It became the property of Mother Russia. Ward of a secret program and its administrator. One of the two male hands that receives the baby flashes heavy RING with a GOLD STAR on a RED ENAMEL BACKGROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s former glory now threadbare. Sleet pelts the windows The infant child in an basket on a table. Alone. Wailing.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Cold War was at it's coldest and Brezhnev was determined that it was America who would be crushed. And 2nd only to his nuclear arsenal, Brezhnev's weapon would be espionage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG CHENKOV, 5, stands by a little desk, head shaved on sides in a military cut. SEVEN CLASSMATES behind and beyo Uniformity rules; it’s hard to tell the boys from the gir

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Young Chenkov learned English long before Russian. Drilled in idiom, idiosyncrasy and ideology.

dialogues.speaker: CLASS, (TOGETHER)
dialogues.text: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America... We focus in on young Chenkov’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: CHENKOV
dialogues.text: .+-and to the Republic for which it stands: one Nation under God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt smiles, looses a smoke ring that drifts toward Zykov

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You’re killing me, Oleg. When does the good fairy show up?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Never. It’s a story without hope.  As the smoke ring widens, drifts past him...

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Peabody suddenly aware of something. He looks to Techie O

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Get on his hands. Show me his ring. Techie One hits the keyboard, manipulates the image of Zy on the screen into a CLOSE-UP of his hands... a heavy old RING: gold star on a red background.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what that is? He’s been awarded the goddamn Hero of the Soviet Union. How is that not in the data-base? Bottoms shrugs, Peabody makes him very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: Have you ever been in a place from where hope was gone? Where all that's left is patience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chenkov, now 7, in the middle of a tumbling run: the end double somersault. Not enough rotation. A hard landing fl on the ass. Chenkov sits there, worn out. Finally stands.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Young Chenkov was taught persistence. Tenacity. Another hard TUMBLING RUN ends with the same results exce this time flat on the back, Chenkov’s head snapping back. Chenkov sits there a beat, worn out, trying not to cry. Then looking up as two adult feet step up. The tears are there, but they will not fall. As Chenkov stands again... EXT. ARMY BARRACKS — DAY Soviet SPEZNATZ ‘fight-train’, grappling, going over brut elbows, headbutts and knees. Cage fighters with no cage. They stop to watch as six children are marched over. 10-y old Chenkov steps up, assumes a fighter’s stance.  10.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Trained to fight. The Speznatz INSTRUCTOR LAUGHS. Chenkov grimly stomps dow hard on his foot, kicks him full force in the groin. The Instructor drops to a knee, gasping. As his men laugh...

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And to accept the consequences. Chenkov resumes the stance. The instructor responds with vicious BACKHAND, sends the little body flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The begrimed and filthy children march and stumble, carry heavy packs on their shoulders. Leaning forward, knees scraped and bloody from falls, the exhaustion and enormou strain evident. Staggered in a line, Chenkov in the lead. Chenkov reaches a STAKE in the ground, the top fluttering ORANGE FLAG. Chenkov breathes. The others join one-by-one Chenkov looks up as we hear CAR TIRES crunch up. The last child to cross is SHNAIDER, eyes the PALEST BLUE They blink as a car door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Taught what it means to be a comrade. They look up as an overcoated adult steps INTO FRAME befo them. A BAMBOO SWITCH in a hand which bears a familiar ri

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: <Who crossed first?> Chenkov’s hand goes up. VOICE (CONT’D) <Who crossed last?> Shnaider hand reluctantly raises. The switch motions the to the side. As they and the man disappear from frame, th rest of the children watch. We hear the switch CRACKING down. The children begin to recite.

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: I will not desert my comrade wherever I am stationed. I will fight both alone and with all to help me. So my motherland will not be diminished, but grow greater than before.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight little beds in a stark, bereft row. Quiet except fo the MUFFLED CRYING of one the children: SCNAIDER, who is bed seven across from Chenkov in bed eight. Chenkov watching Shnaider cry his pale blue eyes out. As looks to Chenkov for sympathy...

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Taught to seek the comfort that is only found within. Chenkov turns away, would rather stare into the darkness. Shnaider continues to cry...

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But most of all, Chenkov was instilled with an unquestioning loyalty to the state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One after the next, the children step forward to KISS ZYK RING. Chenkov is last. Chenkov turns the child’s face fro side-to-side, deciding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoic Chenkov prepped for surgery - cut lines being drawn across the face with a marker by a SURGEON.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And finally given a new identity, a face surgically altered to resemble that of a visiting American teenager. Chenkov being wheeled through a set of doors into a SOVIE OPERATING ROOM. With finality, the doors swing shut.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Young Chenkov then left Russia. The American teenager did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Salt waits for more as Zykov lights another butt.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Are you saying this Chenkov is here in the United States?  12. Zykov nods. Salt turns her head, looks into the cold reflection of the two-way glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTER looks to Techie Two monitoring Zykov’s NEURAL SCAN

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE TWO
dialogues.text: So far the fMRI scan registers truthful on everything he’s said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zykov grinds his cigarette out in the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Chenkov is designee KA-8.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Try again. The KA program was Cold War propaganda. A myth.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Until today. Because today is the day Chenkov will be tasked. The long awaited mission is here. (grim; eyes on her) Today Chenkov will travel to New York City to kill Russian President Boris Maelev at the funeral of Vice President Oates.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Winter reacts. Bottoms reads off his computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOMS
dialogues.text: KA. A Cold War program to insert sleeper agents into American society. The program was theorized as active in the 1980’s. However, no evidence of its existence has ever been found.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Salt looks at him. Her eyes dip darkly.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: A Russian agent is going to kill the Russian president? Is that it? Zykov nods solemnly.  13.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now what do you want in return, Mr. Zykov? Money? Chemotherapy? Health care’s pretty shitty back home, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: I simply wish to help you do what you need to do. (a beat) Don’t you want the name? The alias that this Chenkov lives under? Salt smiles, begins softly clapping.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You're very good. And I’ve seen the best. KA-8. Brilliant bullshit. (checks her watch) But I’m off duty. You can tell the rest of it to one of my colleagues. Salt stands, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Salt. Salt stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: The name. The name of the Soviet agent is Salt. Evelyn Salt. Time stands still. And then...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: My name is Evelyn Salt.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Then you, my dear, are a Russian spy.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: You could hear a pin drop. Tech Two checks the neural sca

dialogues.speaker: NEURAL TECH
dialogues.text: --. truthful ... The door opens. Salt enters the room’s stunned vacuum. Bu she doesn’t notice because, taking her CELLPHONE from her pocket, she’s already out the next door.  14.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Whoa! Where are you going?! And he’s right on her heels.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY TWO
dialogues.text: Salt on her way down the hall, punching in a number. Peabody catches up, grabs her shoulder from behind. She spins, stops, angrily bats him off with her ear to the ph From the phone you can hear an ANSWERING MACHINE pick up

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Mike’s not here. Leave a message. At the BEEP, Salt urgent, suddenly sounds scared.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Mike, it’s me. Call me when you get this. Please, right away. (clicks off) Shit. Winter here now as well.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Ev?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: When they blow up a spy, they don’t just blow their cover - they blow up their whole cover life. So they can’t go back. (a beat as the stare) Ted, if they’ve mistaken me for their long lost spy, then they’ve mistaken Mike for their spy’s husband. He could be in danger. Her eyes desperate.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: If. That’s a big word. Salt aware of him again.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me. She moves to go. He blocks her.  15.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Salt? When Salt speaks now, her voice cracks ...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Home. (to Winter) You know what this is about. I compromised their agent in South Korea and now they're repaying the favor. (urgent) Ted, you know me.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Chenkov. They all look to see: Zykov - with Bottoms and the securi officer - just out the door of the observation room.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Godspeed, Comrade. And then they’re leading him the other way down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Someone interrogate that piece of shit! Someone who enjoys getting answers! He turns his hard gaze back to Salt. She looks sick.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I swear to you I am not who he says I am. I am not a spy. Clearly affected, Winter looks to Peabody.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Procedure on this is very clear. Trembling, Salt finally just nods. The tension in her bod turning to resignation. TWO more SECURITY OFFICERS come from the direction Zykov taken. As Peabody looks to them ever so briefly -- -- WHUMP! Salt chops his neck with the heel of her hand, then kicks his legs out from under him. As she sprints do the hall -- The security officers charge after her. MOVE WITH them, drawing their 9mm sidearms as they go.  16. She motors hard ahead, disappearing around a CORNER. As they follow...

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: She’s crouched low, just a foot inside. As the first security officer barrels around, Salt blows up like a linebacker on a goal line stand. His gun clatte As the second swings his aim around, Salt catches his arm twists it and him around. She relieves him of his 9mm, th sends him headfirst into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open. Salt steps off. The ALARMS start to sound KLAXONS going off. The halls filling with people headed for the exits. Salt slipping into the flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottoms and the security officer reacting to the alarms. Zykov smiling -- -- clipping the inside of his right shoe against his left Springing a 4-inch STEEL BLADE out the toe of the right. He arcs a kick hard into the security officer’s thigh. The security officer drops to his knees. Zykov sidesteps Bottoms even as he unspools a STEEL LINE his wristwatch, wraps it viciously around Bottoms’ throat As the security officer reaches for his gun -- Zykov’s ri foot arcs up and the blade slices through the officer's throat. And Zykov still hangs onto Bottoms. A red line circumscri the young man’s neck as the wire disappears inside. A bea before the blood floods out. Zykov releases him, scoots back to keep from being soiled  17. As Bottoms hits the floor, Zykov takes the security offic 9mm and ID and calmly disappears around the corner leavin two corpses in his wake. Not bad for an old man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMPLOYEES evacuating. Swiping their ID cards as SECURITY TEAMS scan faces. Salt’s FACE up on the screens. Their ey looking only for her.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Stops short well back from the security check. Can’t go t way. As she starts back against the flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of EMPLOYEES on their way down. Alarms SHRILL a Salt takes the stairs up four at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt bangs through the stairwell door into an abandoned corridor. As the LIGHTS flick off, replaced by flashing emergency red, an ominous hard click behind her. She tries the stairwell door. It has remotely locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveillance feeds are being cycled and scanned by the technicians. An IMAGE of Salt prowling the corridor. Winter and Peabody enter. Peabody recovered.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECH
dialogues.text: Got her! Third floor.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Isolate and seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt reacting as REINFORCED STEEL DOORS clang shut at the of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter and Peabody watch as SALT heads the other directio

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: What about the other exits?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECH
dialogues.text: Everything's locked down except for the main entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zykov slides his stolen ID through the scanner, exits wit the other employees. Security looking only for Salt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALT skids into another corridor - STEEL DOORS at the far SLAM into place. She makes instantly for the ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peabody, watching on the monitors, reacts instantly.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Kill the power to the elevator doors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt swipes her CODE-CARD at the elevator. Nothing. She looks up at the closed-circuit CAMERA. Knows she's trappe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter looks to the Tech.  19.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: What about the windows?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECH
dialogues.text: Blast-proof and therefore sealed.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Gas her. Winter looks to Peabody, startled. The Tech hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said gas her. And get a tactical team on the south stairwell. As Peabody charges out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt is running back. Searching for some way out. THICK YELLOW GAS starts drifting out the ventilation duct Stopping short, she takes a huge gulp of breath, holds it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter raises his watch.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: How long till she goes down?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECH
dialogues.text: Depends on how long she can hold her breath. Ninety seconds maybe. Click. Winter activates his watch timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breath held, Salt enters the office carrying a CO2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER. She sets it down, picks up the fancy SWIVEL CHAIR and, flipping it, slams it down on top of the desk. She sets her fingernails, tears open the housing. A controlled fury as she yanks out the chair’s GAS PISTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tooled-up TACTICAL TEAM take positions outside the 3rd floor door. Wearing GAS MASKS, their H&K G36C’s slung and ready to rip.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Make a hole. They clear as Peabody comes up to the door. Assault rifle hand and gas mask on top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Knock knock. A beat and the sound of a bolt sliding back. Peabody lowe his mask, nods. Leading with the H&Ks, the team makes ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes tearing from the gas, Salt rifles cabinets, finds a FIRST AID KIT, and from under a sink, AMMONIA. She grabs heavy handful of paper towels from the dispenser and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the MONITOR: Salt enters a hall carrying her supplies, disappears into the office. Winter checks his timer: 1:12...1:13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air thick with gas. Silent as ghosts, Peabody leads t tactical team down the hall. Over their headsets:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: She’s in the office by the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several paper towels are stained brown with the IODINE Sa has poured into them. She now adds the ammonia. As white noxious FUMES begin to rise...  21. She flips over a metal side TABLE, yanks one of the legs and forth until it tears free. Popping off the leveler... She rolls the fuming towels, and inserts them into the ta leg. Followed by the gas piston and more towels for waddi She then attaches the CO2 extinguisher to the end, pressu fitting the horn into the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peabody and team by the elevators, eyeing the offices ahe Hand signals as they flank each other, rifles ready. And Salt steps out, the RIG up on her shoulder. She pulls the extinguisher’s actuator handle and... WHOOSH! Tactical team members DIVING out of the way as -- -- the homemade MISSILE fires past them and strikes the elevator doors. BOOM! Blowing them open. Peabody and the tactical team knocked off their feet by t shock wave. They’re up quick, but not before... SALT dashes into the elevator, punches open the utility hatch. A barrage of bullets follow, but her feet disappea up and through.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Fourth floor! Fourth floor! As they charge for the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fifteen inch gap between elevator and shaft. As Salt shimmy/squeezes down... She’s headed down not up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they cycle through all the cameras trying to find her.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECH
dialogues.text: There. ON SCREEN: Salt sprinting down a hallway  22. SECURITY TECH (CONT’D) That’s the first floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears into an office. It takes Winter a moment t realize, but he realizes.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: That’s my office. As he rushes out and the Tech reports it on the radio...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WINTER’S OFFICE - DAY Winter hurries in. Nearly falls as his foot slides over t shell casings all over the floor. His window has been sho out. Reaching it, he looks out: WINTER’S POV Across the street, making the far corner. Salt turns. Loo directly back up at him. PEOPLE crossing the intersection suddenly obscure her. As they pass on, Salt is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clogged with COMMUTERS. A BUSINESSMAN in a suit, a jacket over his arm, talks on his mobile as he walks toward the exit. He’s bumped, jostled -- -- Looks about futilely as he realizes his jacket is gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train comes in, doors open. Pulling on the JACKET, Salt hauls ass down the steps, hops on. She anxiously watching the platform. Finally, mercifully, the doors clo The metro starts away. She sits heavily in a seat, takes out her cellphone. She looks at it a beat, decides, then dials. It rings and...  23.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Mike’s not here. Leave a message. At the beep Salt rips the back cover off, yanks out the battery, then the SIM card which she snaps in half. Several PASSENGERS are looking at her. Salt flashes her e at them, daring them to keep looking. None of them do. The lights of the tunnel strobe by. Nothing for Salt to d but try not to cry and remember...

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Salt steps into frame. Dense ferns rising behind her. She walks in wonder, looking up as several wildly colorful BUTTERFLIES flutter overhead. Where are we? And then...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Do you come here often? She looks back at MIKE DUNCAN. Unkempt hair, beard, a bit handsome, eyes that don’t miss much.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Are you talking to me? He nods. In the jungle. What an odd place to meet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’ve seen you here before. Only then do we reverse to show we are in...

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTTERFLY PAVILION
dialogues.text: An ‘aviary’ within the museum. The mesh confine is home t many live butterflies. Salt looks about, back to him.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I come here a lot. What’s your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I work upstairs. I’m an arachnologist.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: A spider hunter.  24. She looks at hima beat. He smiles. A boyish, charming smile. She can’t help but smile back.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You look like one.

dialogues.speaker: A SPIDER, (FLASHBACK)
dialogues.text: On its WEB in a terrarium. Salt looking closely at it. It a species of RAY SPIDER. We’re in the ENTOMOLOGY DEPARTME

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: 40,000 species of spiders in the world. That one’s mine.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You discovered it?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: In the Amazon Basin on the Peru border. I named it Theridiosoma Petebesti... Get it?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: No. Should I?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Pete-best-i. I named him after Pete Best. The drummer before Ringo. She frowns, shakes her head. Still doesn’t get it. MIKE (CONT’D) Best was never a famous Beatle, but now he’s a famous spider.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I think if I discovered a new species, I’d give it a better name. But that’s just me. An entomologist (WOODHALL) rambles by looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen my glasses?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: They’re on your head. He reaches up to the top of his head. His glasses are the  25.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: Thank you. As he heads back the way he came...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s Woodhall. He’s raising a bedbug colony in his office. Using his own blood. She nods as though this is quite a normal thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for the tour --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hold on. You still gotta tell me. Why do you come to the museum so much? She looks at him a beat, decides to confess.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Because I can get away from myself here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Being alone in a crowd does that sometimes. Weird, huh? Weird. Two kindred spirits have met. As they realize it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt emerges. The jacket’s collar pulled up, she hangs at the station entrance, looking across at...

dialogues.speaker: THE ELLINGTON APARTMENTS
dialogues.text: Seven stories. Home. Stepping off the curb, Salt starts across the street. A few quick steps and she disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens. Salt hits the stop button, holdi it there. As she heads down the hall...  26.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: The hallway empty except for Salt who draws the 9mm she t She turns her key in the lock and slides inside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. FRONT ENTRY - SALT’S APARTMENT - LATE AFTERNOON Quiet. Still. Leading with the gun, Salt starts across th LIVING ROOM, suddenly wheels at a sound. It’s a little MONGREL DOG.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (softly) Burt... Gun ready, she crouches to give him the scratch he wants.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BLACK VANS pull up. Doors slide back and the ten stro CIA tactical team roll out. Peabody leading and Winter bringing up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One elevator on 3, the other on 7. Leaving two men in the lobby, Peabody and the rest head for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KITCHEN - SALT’S APARTMENT - DAY Salt passing through. ‘Burt’ on her heels. A single plate on the table. A half-eaten sandwich. A half glass of beer

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BEDROOM - SALT’S APARTMENT - DAY A PHOTO on a dresser. Mike and her. In a real jungle somewhere. Mike holding a SPIDER up on the back of his ha Salt enters, pulls open the big drawer at the bottom of t dresser. She sweeps away the folded underwear to reveal:  27. A medium BLACK DUFFLE BAG. As she yanks it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tactical team on either side of the door. Peabody crouched low, picking the lock. We hear the bolt slide ba Peabody turns the knob. Pushes. The door gives slightly a then holds firmly. Peabody looks to the man with the STEEL RAM.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. FRONT ENTRY - SALT’S APARTMENT - DAY Old school: a chair has been tilted, set up under the doorknob. The door is suddenly hammered once -- the frame splintering. Twice -- it comes off its hinges and -- M84 STUN GRENADES are tossed in. BOOOM! Flash and Bang. The light blinding.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: Salt ducking back at the implosion.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The tactical team invades, moving to sweep the place.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Another M84 tossed in. BOOOM! The window cracks. The team enters. She’s not here. As Peabody stands there.

dialogues.speaker: TACTICAL
dialogues.text: (toward door) All clear! One coming out! As tactical #1 exits, Winter enters.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: There’s nobody home.  28.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Has it occurred to you that maybe that Russian was lying?

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: The neural scan was --

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: To hell with the neural scan! Maybe he found a way to beat it. Maybe Salt is Salt.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: That’s not my problem.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Then what is?

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Catching her so we can find out. (to Tactical #2) Get a team up here. Tear this place apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt. FREE CLIMBING up the side of the building. Finding foot and toe holds in miniscule seams. The black duffle bag slung over her shoulder. ‘Burt’ sticking his h up through the top of her zipped jacket. Up to the 7th floor. She pulls herself onto a terrace. She’s up and over a privacy wall in an instant, lands on.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TERRACE
dialogues.text: She looks through the glass: a 10-year-old GIRL is doing homework at a table. Salt knocks on the glass. The girl looks over, recognizes her. Salt waves her over. The girl opens the slider.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Hi, Janey.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: How did you get up here?  29.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I climbed. Don’t tell anyone. (scanning through glass) Is your mom home?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Can you do me a favor? Can you baby sit Burt for me? The girl nods. Salt hands over the dog. The girl is thrilled, obviously knows him. Salt hands her a few $20s.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He likes Pedigree choice cuts. Before the girl can answer, Salt is gone, vaulting over t next wall onto the next terrace.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. LIVING ROOM - SALT’S APARTMENT - NIGHT (FLASHBACK) Salt on the couch. Wrapped in a blanket. Laying on her side. She looks abject. Desolate. A KNOCK on the door which is still on its hinges. Salt ignores it. Another knock. Finally she gets up, steps over, looks through the peepho sees Mike’s profile out there.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (worn out) Why are you here, Mike? MIKE’S VOICE I was thinking about what you said. She rests the top of her head on the door, sighs. MIKE’S VOICE (CONT’D) About how hard it is for you to get close to people. Another beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: We've been over this. Just go away.  30. MIKE’S VOICE Okay. I’1l leave. But open the door for one second. Please. Salt opens the door about six inches. Mike looks in on he Not trying to be cute or charming. Just looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I think you need something to practice on.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: How about a spider? We have about the same capacity for human feeling.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe Burt.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Burt? Mike takes his hand from behind his back. He holds the PU version of ‘Burt’. She gives it and Mike about as stony a look as she can. T she holds out her hand. He hands ‘Burt’ through the door. As she takes him...

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1l work on it.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIKE
dialogues.text: The door shuts in his face. He stands there a moment, the starts down the hall. He’s almost gone when her door open back up. He turns as Salt looks out.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He peed on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Life is messy. Her eyes well up with tears. He walks back, looks at her. MIKE (CONT’D) See? Spiders can’t cry.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I’m not crying.  31.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Spiders can’t almost cry either. There’s more puppy in you than spider.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Clean the pee. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay. As he enters ahead of her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENTRANCE FOYER. Most people are leaving as Salt enter A DESK DOCENT looks over.

dialogues.speaker: DESK DOCENT
dialogues.text: Ma‘am, we close in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I‘1ll just be five. As Salt continues, the desk docent suddenly frowns, then looks down at her keyboard, the little print-out PHOTO st there: of Salt. Next to one of Mike. As the desk docent nervously reaches for the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a public part of the museum. Salt entering. Ona mission. As she strides, she stops short, looks in on... Woodhall (the guy looking for his glasses earlier). He ha his arm thrust down in his bedbug tank. Salt suddenly looks completely at ease...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Hey, Woodhall. As he squints, sees it’s her.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: Hiya, Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Is Mike still here?  32.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: He left a couple hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Thought so. Is the stripping room open? He left something in there.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: It should be. We're working it overtime for the mammalogists. And she’s gone. Woodhall blinks after her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, creepy. Salt enters a long, low room lined with lar dimensioned Plexiglas vats. The first contains a nearly stripped skeleton of an adult GRIZZLY BEAR. The next and one after that: strange DARK AMORPHOUS SHAPES. Salt pauses at the second. It seems to be moving. It take a second to realize. The shape is formed by thousands of insects. BEETLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street in front of the museum fills with FEDERAL CARS skidding up, spilling agents. Two familiar BLACK VANS. As Peabody hops out, meeting agents from the other van...

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Her husband works here. Entomology. And they’re jamming inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a flinch, Salt pulls out a beetle. As it writhes between her fingers, she snaps it in half. Watches closel as a bead of CLEAR FLUID wells up from the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WOODHALL’S OFFICE - LATE AFTERNOON As Woodhall steps out of his office, turns right -- Freezes at the ASSAULT RIFLE pointed at his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ENTOMOLOGY DEPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Peabody aiming the rifle. The hallway behind him filled w heavily armed men.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: (whispered) Salt... Woodhall gestures over his shoulder with a trembling thum

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: The stripping room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt starts for the door, sees the APPROACHING SHADOWS through the frosted glass.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The team approach the door. Peabody sets his palm on it. it swings open...

dialogues.speaker: STRIPPING ROOM
dialogues.text: A lone beetle looks up through the grizzly’s eye socket a the team glides in. Alert. On edge. Peabody hitting the fluorescents as they enter, fan out. The lights flicker to life, fully revealing the Plexiglas vats. The beetles. But no Salt. The WINDOW at the end of the room is open. Peabody hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: Peabody sticks his head out, looks down at the lawn three stories down. No Salt in sight. Realizing something, Peabody twists around, looks up. Nothing above him either. The roofline only a story above however. Peabody ducks back in.  34.

dialogues.speaker: STRIPPING ROOM
dialogues.text: Peabody to his boys:

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Get up on the roof and out to the sculpture garden! Go! As they charge out leaving Peabody looking at Woodhall wh at the door.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are these things?

dialogues.speaker: WOODHALL
dialogues.text: Dermestes Vulpinus. Flesh-eating beetles. They strip the bones on the vertebrates. For the mammalogists. Disgusted, Peabody heads out. Woodhall switches off the lights, follows after him. The door closing. A beat and then, a horrible BLACK FIGURE leaps from one o the vats! Beetles shedding in every direction as...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Shakes them off, spits them out. Uncovering herself. As s jumps to the ground and they crunch underfoot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt walks past the American History Museum, stops to pul her black duffle bag out of the bushes where she stashed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headed toward the Smithsonian. Winter in the backseat. He sits up as they pass Salt going the other way. The SECURI OFFICER beside him sees her as well.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Shit, that’s her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt reacting as TIRES screech to a halt behind her. With looking back, she starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peabody's headset squawks to life.

dialogues.speaker: HEADSET VOICE
dialogues.text: She’s leaving Madison headed north of the History Museum. As Peabody about faces, goes into motion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALT dashes out into a street. The dark sedan power-slide around the corner, grabs traction, takes off after her. Suddenly, another FEDERAL CAR ahead, hauling ass toward h Salt sprints hard at it, then darts down an...

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: Running hard, the duffle bag slung over her shoulder. The federal car turns in behind her, followed by the dark sedan. Salt keeps motoring, but then... A SECOND FEDERAL CAR barrels down the alley straight at h Salt running. Two cars chasing and one coming right at he She draws the 9mm, aims straight ahead as she runs. Fires two rounds into the engine block of the car coming at her another into the left front tire. As the car slows with a shudder, she high-step onto the h then the roof and finally off the trunk. As she continues down the alley... The two federal cars skid to stops facing each other. Ste billowing from under car two’s hood. As the dark sedan REVERSES back down the alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt punches back into the open on the other side of the alley, sprints for all she's worth... Toward an adjacent highway OVERPASS. But Peabody and the two tactical team members move to intersect her on foot. Peabody keying his radio.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: She’s going to cross over the highway! And they race... Salt in the lead. Her pursuers running side by side by side. They’re closin

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop! As he draws his sidearm... One of the black vans slides to a stop on the other side the overpass. She’s trapped. Salt stops in the middle of the bridge, nowhere to go. As Peabody slows to a walk, taking deadly aim. The two tactical team members level their assault rifles.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drop it! A beat, Salts drops the 9mm to the pavement. HIGHWAY TRAFFIC speeding beneath. They speak over the roa

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (closing) On the ground. Face down. She just stands there. Peabody stops. PEABODY (CONT’D) You want to live? Down!

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I’m innocent.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Then why’d you run?  37.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Because if they targeted me, then my husband might be caught in it, too. Just let me find him, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Not my problem, Salt. Country, duty, and the greater fucking good. They all exceed personal considerations.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You believe that Russian asshole? You should be talking to him, not me.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: I can’t talk to him. He killed Bottoms and Davis. He got away.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Why would he expose me and then run? What’s the point?! Think! He cocks back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Last chance, Salt. I’m only going -- He’s in mid-speak when -- She suddenly throws herself backwards, rolls over the railing and DROPS AWAY. BANG! He fires at the exact same time!

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Somersaulting, her feet hit the top of a passing 18 WHEEL speeding past below... She tumbles backwards, finally coming to a sprawled stop before pitching off the back of the big rig.

dialogues.speaker: OVERPASS
dialogues.text: Peabody steps up to the railing, sees... Salt. She spots him. As both realize... The truck she is on is carrying her directly back to him. She whirls, eyes finding... A PLUMBER'S BOX VAN heading towards her. The next interchange down.  38. Peabody FIRES; bullets BLAST HOLES in the metal at her fe She runs! Leaps! Soars into space before... Landing on the roof of the... PLUMBER’S BOX VAN Driving beside the 18 wheeler. It’s a lower profile vehic

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Lose their shot, hold fire. As they watch her go, Peabody back on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s on the highway eastbound. On the roof of a white box van.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Taking one moment to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ROOF - PLUMBER’S BOX VAN - LATE AFTERNOON Salt reacting as TRAFFIC SUDDENLY SLOWS. A BLOCKADE a 1/4 a mile ahead. The speed quickly down to 10 mph. Salt jumps down to the hood of the box van. The DRIVER reacts as she times her next jump and lands on the back o

dialogues.speaker: A PASSING MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: The GUY on it splitting lanes. Salt has to reach around h take the handlebars to keep them from wiping out. As they come to a sideways skidding stop, she uses moment to send him off the bike. Revving it now, riding a wheeli back the other way, she traverses the median, jumps the d and lands headed the other direction on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They react to Salt coming back at them. Take aim, except.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Crosses three lanes, hits an EXIT RAMP instead.  39.

dialogues.speaker: OVERPASS
dialogues.text: They watch her spiral away, disappear down the ramp. Gone

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Five minutes on that thing and she could be anywhere. Peabody turns to one of his guys.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Notify the Secret Service on Maelev’s detail that Salt may be coming at them. Winter reacting, looking over.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Zykov said she was tasked to New York to kill the Russian president. Maelev has a right to know the threat.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Jesus, get your head out of your ass! Peabody turns toward him.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Oh, is that where it is?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: (steps forward) It makes zero sense! The Russians have activated a Russian sleeper agent? To kill their own president? Come on! Think. Peabody considers him a long, cold beat before...

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: And where’s your head? Huh? You got a thing for her? Is that it? They’re nearly toe-to-toe now.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: I think I hit a nerve.  40.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: You fucking CI guys -- It’s about to lead to blows, when their men separate them Winter mastering himself. Peabody as well. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn it...

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: You’re her friend. Where would she go now? From here?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: (shrugs, concedes...) New York’s as good a guess as any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN MOTORCYCLES parked out front. Salt rumbles up, pa hers in the middle of them all. Hiding it there. Killing the engine, she jumps off, hurries down the street and aw WHUMP! A MAN coming around the corner bumps her. Salt instantly assumes a fighter’s stance. The man raises his hands in mock surrender, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I’m a lover, not a fighter As she continues past him and away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt securely bound to a wooden chair. Wrists, ankles, elbows, knees and waist. Lip split, both eyes black, bloo and beaten. Nearly beyond reason. Alone in a concrete cel Rusty pipes overhead. A place from which hope is long gon She looks up as the door opens. Her NORTH KOREAN INTERLOCUTOR enters followed by his MUSCLE-BOUND ENFORCER

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (voice breaking) I told you. I’m a businesswoman. I’m not a spy. Her inquisitor grabs a stool, sits across from her.  41.

dialogues.speaker: NK INTERLOCUTOR
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I work for Diversified Petroleum. Call them and -- WHUMP. Muscle-bound delivers a short, heavy shot into her ribs. Salt gasps for air. Her interlocutor waits a patient beat, then lifts her chi

dialogues.speaker: NK INTERLOCUTOR
dialogues.text: Try again. She considers him, answers by rote at this point.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You have three continental shelves. Seohan Bay, Donghan Bay and Gilju near Pyongyang. All are thought to have oil fields beneath them... Muscle-bound moves in. The interlocutor waves him off, lo overhead instead. Salt can only watch and wait as muscle-bound grabs a knot nylon ROPE, throws a LOOPED END up over one of the rusty pipes. The little loop swings right in front of her face.

dialogues.speaker: NK INTERLOCUTOR
dialogues.text: You are here to sabotage our nuclear ambitions, yes? Muscle-bound slips it over her head.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I’m a businesswoman. I came to North Korea to -- Muscle-bound pulls the rope taut. Then slowly hauls down, fists over the knots. The interlocutor stands as Salt slowly comes up off the floor, chair and all. The idea is not to kill, but to cho Salt’s face goes red. Her eyes bulge. The Koreans just watch. The chair about three feet off the ground. As her right hand spasms open and shut, the interlocutor looks to muscle-bound who slowly sets her back down.  42. The interlocutor hooks a finger into the rope around her throat, pulls it loose. Salt gasps for breath. They wait few seconds, until...

dialogues.speaker: NK INTERLOCUTOR
dialogues.text: We know what you are. You’re going to die. It can be today, or after a week of this, or a month. It’s up to you.... So, try again. And even though Salt’s pretty sure she’s going to die her

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: The tuff layer and geological features of Seohan Bay are almost identical to those of Bohai Bay. The Chinese estimate there are 20.5 billion tons of oil -- Muscle-bound pulls, raises her up. Four feet off the grou the chair swinging slightly back and forth as Salt chokes The interlocutor grabs the frame of the chair, starts to down on it.

dialogues.speaker: NK INTERLOCUTOR
dialogues.text: It will be today. But now he’s close enough. Her right hand catches, grabs interlocutor’s face. Digs in talon-like. Before muscle- bound can react to what’s happening, the damage is severe The interlocutor HOWLS. The chair SLAMS to the ground. Sa ends up on her side. Blood seeps between the interlocutor fingers. As he lowers his hand, his left eye is gone. Salt grins before muscle-bound viciously kicks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter watching a steel mesh covered door. Waiting behind him, his prisoner: a KOREAN MAN in a suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Two days home in North Korea and you'll be begging to go back to a US prison cell. The Korean man ignores him, does not deign to answer. Suddenly the lock on the door BUZZES open. Salt limps out Eyes still black, lip still split, throat lurid with brui  43. She’s surprised to see Winter. He takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your head down; don't say anything until we're on the outside. He looks at Salt’s NK Interlocutor who stands behind her.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In case Kim Jong-il changes his mind. The interlocutor bows to the Korean man, then shakes his hand, the prisoner exchange complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing outside, a protective Winter sticks close to Salt they head toward a WAITING CAR. She’s completely drained, but still wondering...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: You don’t understand what?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: All the rules say you should’ve left me here. One life, against a lot of others. Why’d you blow operational cover to get me out?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I didn't. He points towards the car - where just emerging from the door is MIKE. As she reacts...

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once he found out where you were, he moved heaven and earth to get you out. We had to do something or he was going to invade this goddam rice- paddy republic himself. Salt blinks, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Salt both in the backseat, but about as far apar two people can be. She stares out the window. He looks at her, the bruises. Not an easy sight for a lover to understand much less accept. Finally, he looks away as we

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: When I started to think I might never see you again... Mike stops, just shakes his head at the thought. MIKE (CONT’D) I thought of all the things I’d never know. Like why you cry sometimes in your sleep. Or why you don’t seem to make as much money as someone in the oil business should. (a beat) Or if we ever had a daughter, would she look like you? She wells up at that, but doesn’t cry and doesn’t look ov

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Would you want her to?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Of course. Maybe not today... She half laughs/ half cries at that one. A beat and final she reaches out. Her hand stretched blindly. He takes it. MIKE (CONT’D) I love you, Salt. You made a scientist believe in magic. (a beat) And I would accept anything about you. If I only knew. So maybe you could start by telling me what you really do for a living. She looks over at him. Truly beat to shit.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I work for the CIA. And it’s Mike who cries. Because she’s looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s perfect. It means we’re both government employees.  45. He has somehow succeeded in getting her to smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus heading toward the Lincoln Tunnel from the New Je side. Salt staring out the window. And as we let the bus and crane up to the night skyline of MANHATTAN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Municipal. Cheap drop ceilings and fluorescent lights. Office Depot chairs. But an outrageous lavender curtain framing the windows and a cheap plastic garden trellis covered with plastic flowers in front of a podium. Salt and Winter wait here. Cooling their heels. Waiting f something. The room pregnant with unspoken words. Finally

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: That’s a nice touch. He gestures to the entrance door. It is covered with wrapping paper and has a big white bow in the center of i

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: What if I’m no good at it?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: At what?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: At living with someone. At being with someone this closely?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: No problem. You can get divorced down on the first floor. She looks at him: Be serious.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re asking the wrong person, Ev. I’m like a priest, married to the church of my job. It’s the only way I can do it. Getting very anxious, she starts to look around. Winter watching her, smiling.  46.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Stop what?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Looking for the back way out of here. Busted... As they consider each other.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to know what I think? I think Mike Duncan is the luckiest sonuvabitch who ever lived.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You do? Winter considers her, nods. Salt steps over, ‘plucks’ a PLASTIC FLOWER from the trellis, sticks it in Winter’s la

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ted. He lifts it to smell it. Shakes his head. Nothing there. Suddenly the JUSTICE OF THE PEACE enters.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE OF THE PEACE
dialogues.text: Alright, are you my next victims? Winter points at Salt.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: She is. I’m here to witness. Just then, out of breath, Mike hurries in with Woodhall i tow. He stops short at the sight of Salt. As the two of them consider each other, Winter slightly wistful before.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Justice) All victims accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black duffle bag over her shoulder, baseball cap pulled l clothes changed, Salt walks away from the Port Authority towards the MODELL’S SPORTING GOODS on 42nd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MODELL’S - NIGHT A pair of soccer SHIN GUARDS goes in a basket. Hockey ELB PADS follow. Wrist wrap FIGHTING GLOVES. Salt is shopping. A HANDSOME CREEP watching her as she considers a MOUTH GUARD. She doesn’t look over, but knows he’s there.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Do you work here or something?

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME CREEP
dialogues.text: (grins) No... She drops a black mouthguard in her basket, heads for the checkout. He watches her ass as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. MODELL’S - NIGHT Handsome creep steps out, just catches a glimpse of Salt she disappears around the corner. He follows. As he turns the corner, she’s there. She grabs his wrist, bends his arm behind his back and faces him into the bric of a building. It takes her an instant. And it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Why are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME CREEP
dialogues.text: I wasn’t. She bends his thumb over. Now he’s in serious pain. HANDSOME CREEP (CONT’D) I was just checking you out! She pulls out his wallet, flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You done checking?

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME CREEP
dialogues.text: Uh huh. She shoves the wallet back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Then go home.  48. She slams his face into the bricks, then releases him.

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME CREEP
dialogues.text: Blood streams from his broken nose, his eyes full of tear

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME CREEP
dialogues.text: Oh shit... As he turns, looks around... Salt is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deskman takes the CREDIT CARD Salt slides across. As scans his computer screen...

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DESKMAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Here you are, Miss Schmidt. One night, a deluxe room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt sets her black duffle bag on the bed. Stepping to th window, she pulls back the curtains. Rockefeller Center a the city sparkle beyond. But Salt looks down, finds: ST. PATRICK’S CATHEDRAL. Solitary in its Gothicness. As she considers it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMERICAN FLAG flaps in the breeze as Winter reads from Federal Employee Oath of Office.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I solemnly do swear that I will support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic. While Salt, smart in a suit, stands on the Langley lawn w six other YOUNG OPERATIVE CANDIDATES. Right hands all raised, they repeat the words.  49.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I solemnly do swear that I will support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic. Salt looking at the flag, a huge moment for her.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: And that I will faithfully discharge the duties of the office on which I am about to enter. So help me God.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: And that I will faithfully discharge the duties of the office on which I am about to enter. So help me God. Salt proud, moved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we glide across the black duffle bag open and unpacked the bed: Guns, disposable syringes, medicine, suture and suture needles, packs of gauze, C4, blasting caps, cell phones, a ziploc bag with a dozen beetles in it, passport from different countries including several US, banded sta of Euros, $100 bills. Everything a girl needs for the roa And as we continue past and enter...

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The tap running. Salt just finishing running BLACK DYE through her hair. She looks in the mirror. Considers herself. A different girl than the one who took the oath. As she starts on her eyebrows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ripping sound as duct tape comes off a roll. Salt ina pair of boxers and a T-shirt, taping the shin guards to h legs, pulling on the elbow pads. Loose fitting pants are pulled on, BOOTS laced. Finally, KEVLAR VEST and a heavy SWEATER down over it all. The room is suddenly streaked by early morning light as t sun rises over the buildings across the street.  50. Salt steps over to the desk, retrieves THREE PAGES downlo from the internet: SCHEMAS of subterranean utility-ways. 1. MANHATTAN SUBWAY ACCESS. 2. MANHATTAN UTILITY SCHEMA. 3. ST. PATRICK’S CATHEDRAL CRYPT AND CATACOMB DISPERSAL. She places them over each other and holds them up to the The light making all three schemas visible at once. St. Patrick’s on top. With a pen, Salt pokes a hole through the altar of St. Patrick's Cathedral. As she looks where that lines up on other two maps...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ST. PATRICK’S CATHEDRAL - MANHATTAN - MORNING A horse-drawn catafalque carries a FLAG-COVERED COFFIN. Above there are HELICOPTERS in the air. Secret Service SNIPERS stand on Rockefeller Center roofto Smartly uniformed police at attention as family step from LIMOUSINE past the glare of cameras atop a PRESS scaffold

dialogues.speaker: BBC NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: ...the funeral of Vice President Oates, a former five term US Senator and Cold Warrior, whose greatest legacy may be as architect of the new era of Russo-American relations... And we pick up PEABODY, scanning the faces in the crowd. Unaware as a block north...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Moves through and away from the crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Salt descends, a SATCHEL BAG over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt waiting for the train. A VOICE on the P.A. SPEAKERS.

dialogues.speaker: P.A. VOICE
dialogues.text: Because of the funeral, the 51st and 59th street stations are closed. Repeat due to the funeral -- Salt doesn’t even look at the TWO NYPD COPS at the end of platform by the tunnel mouth. In their heavy gear with assault rifles. Guarding the tunnel. As the TRAIN slows into the station...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT/INT. ST. PATRICK’ CATHEDRAL - DAY Winter in line to enter among other VIPs. IDs checked and rechecked, the metal detectors ominous and sleek. As he enters he sees the Secret Service SUPERVISOR IN CHA He steps over, is recognized.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: What’s the security perimeter?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY COORDINATOR
dialogues.text: We're three deep inside and out. (dry) And that’s Secret Service - not CIA - so relax. Winter bristles at the dig.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘6’ TRAIN - SUBWAY TUNNEL (ROLLING) - DAY Salt aboard. Down at one end of the car.

dialogues.speaker: P.A. VOICE
dialogues.text: ...the 51st and 59th street stations are closed... Through the windows, we see the train is passing through 59th STREET STATION. It’s empty. The train does not stop. Salt opens the door to pass into the next car.  52.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN CARS
dialogues.text: Closing the door behind her. She takes out a KNIFE, cuts through the coupling HOUSING.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY TUNNEL
dialogues.text: It widens where the express train tracks join. As Salt LE from the space between the nine & ten cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hushed CONGREGATION turn as the Marine Honor Guard pa bearers enter with the casket. In lock step down the long aisle. The eerie calm in the great crowded church magnify each footfall. Nave and galleries filled with those who've come from the corners of the earth to pay their final respects. Saris, kaftans, Italian suits, dishdashas. The casket is carried past RUSSIAN PRESIDENT BORIS MAELEV his own SECURITY DETAIL. Maelev SALUTES it. Towards the CARDINAL OF NEW YORK who waits by the pulpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt moving quickly along. She comes to a door marked: Co Edison Utility Access 3-12B. At the sound of clipped RADI TRAFFIC, she ducks into the door’s little alcove. She waits in the shadows as TWO MEMBERS of the NYPD ESU t pass on the express tracks. Clear, she makes short work o picking the PAD LOCK on the door. As she slips inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of MONITORS, all with different feeds. A TECHNICIA watching ONE SCREEN showing Maelev salute the casket. ANCHOR’S VOICE -..as Russian President Boris Maelev salutes the man he has called his greatest friend in the West.  53. The IMAGE switches to the St. Patrick’s as the PRESIDENT THE UNITED STATES squeezes the FIRST LADY’S hand, then approaches the pulpit. ANCHOR’S VOICE (CONT’D) The President of the United States will now say his farewell. Tomorrow it’s on to Camp David where the two leaders will meet at the summit Vice President Oates worked a year to stage as a way forward for Russian American friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the EAST TRANSEPT, WINTER speaks into the microphone i his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: After the President finishes, the choir sings and then Maelev will deliver his eulogy.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ST. PATRICK’ CATHEDRAL - DAY Peabody scanning, listens on his headpiece. Then into his own sleeve mic.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: If your girl tries anything here, it'll have to be pretty damn amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALT moves along, lights her way with the glow off a CELL PHONE SCREEN. Checking her progress against the downloade Maps as she closes on the spot where the pen poked throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president above the flag-draped coffin.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: He gave a young, wet-behind-the-ears candidate a rock to stand next to. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Believe me, I only looked presidential in those days because I had Maxwell Oates beside me. Russian President BORIS MAELEV listens from the front pew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRET SERVICE AGENT in a HARDHAT guards a door here. Y can make out the dull throb of the MUSIC from the other s A muffled VOICE can be half heard over his earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: ..-Status, lima zulu four.

dialogues.speaker: HARDHAT AGENT
dialogues.text: Lima zulu four, all clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt crouched in the dark on top of the pipes. As hardhat clicks off his radio, she clicks the TIMER on her wristwa starts timing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The US President has stepped away. We hear the collective voice of the CHOIR accompanied by the power of St. Patric main PIPE-ORGAN. In Paradisum.

dialogues.speaker: CHOIR
dialogues.text: Requiem aeternam dona eis. Domine, et lux perpetua, Requiem aeternam, Aeternam dona eis. Perpetua luceat. In Paradisum. Christe eleison... Boris Maelev flips through his notes one last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hardhat agent settles back into his spot by the door, just hear the dull throb of the MUSIC from the other side Unaware as...

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Salt still up here, clicking her TIMER to a stop as the muffled radio VOICE is heard over hardhat’s earpiece.  55.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: ...-your status, lima zulu four.

dialogues.speaker: HARDHAT AGENT
dialogues.text: Lima zulu four, all clear. Salt checks the timer: 91 seconds -- -- Then drops to the ground beside him. A knee to his ribs and then the heel of her hand into his temple and hardhat is out cold. As he drops, Salt hits the timer. The 91 seconds now reverse, counting backwards: 00:91... 00:90... As she disappears through the door he was guarding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choir finishes. President Maelev approaches the pulpi Secret services agents discreetly present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An axis of THREE TUNNELS. Out of the sooty black of the subway and into the stone of the crypts beneath St. Patrick’s. Salt appears on the left. Checking her map, she continues onto the right. MOVE WITH her as she continues along, slowly, cautiously, quietly. As the tunnel opens into an actual CRYPT, Salt stops. She holds a dentist’s mirror just outside the edge. She sees: A DOUR Secret Service AGENT. Just standing there. Shiftin his weight back and forth. Salt slides the mirror into her satchel, silently sets th satchel on the floor. Pressing her back against the wall, she takes several deep breaths, getting ready to spring.

dialogues.speaker: DOUR AGENT
dialogues.text: He’s in the CENTRAL CRYPT - the circular room that radiat off the corridors to all the other crypts. Silence. As he reaches up to scratch the back of his neck...  56. Salt CHARGES hard from around the corner. The only reacti there is time for is to defend. The HAND-FIGHTING ferocio Much closer to UFC than ballet. The dour agent holding his own until Salt catches him und the chin with an ELBOW, finishes him with a roundhouse KI As he lands in a heap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Maelev delivers his eulogy.

dialogues.speaker: BORIS MAELEV
dialogues.text: Dos vadanya... In my language it means ‘until we meet again’. That is what my friend Maxwell Oates said to me the last time I saw him. Sadly I did not meet him again. Until today. Mr. Oates was a great man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hardhat agent, still unconscious, as his earpiece ble

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: Lima zulu four, come in? (a beat) What’s your, status, lima zulu four?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ST. PATRICK’S CATHEDRAL - DAY Peabody hovering near the Secret Service Command Post.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO OPERATOR
dialogues.text: We got two MIAs. Lima zulu four in the Con-Ed utility tunnel outside the crypt entrance. And lima-zulu-five in the crypt. The supervisor gets on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Sub-units. Lima zulu one, two and three, converge on the crypts. Repeat, converge on the crypts. Peabody scans a map.  57.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: What’s the nearest subway entrance.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: 5lst street. As Peabody motors away, on his radio as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. GALLERY - ST. PATRICK’S - DAY As Maelev speaks, Winter’s headset tells him. PEABODY’S VOICE Something’s wrong in the crypt.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: MAN NEXT TO WINTER
dialogues.text: Amen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt pulls out a block of C4 from her satchel, hefts it i her hand. Pulling off a chunk, she sticks the rest high o the STONE SUPPORTING COLUMN in the center of the crypt. Working quickly, she stuffs in a blasting cap attached to transmitter. Then draws her 9mm. Looking about, lining up what she nee to do, and then -- She FIRES three shots. Splintering three WOOD ENCASEMENTS Blowing all the stops in the pipe organs’ WIND-CHESTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, in near-instantaneous succession, each of the Cathedral's three pipe organs BLAST a sustained molecule- rattling note at full volumetric pressure. Everyone in the cathedral, Maelev included, are momentari stunned by the blast. WINTER moves, shouting into his radio.  58.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Maelev! Get goddam Maelev!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound roaring in her ears, Salt calmly takes cover around corner, presses down on a garage door opener. The central column EXPLODES!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ST. PATRICK’S CATHEDRAL - DAY The assembled react to a HARD SUDDEN JOLT and then... A huge ERUPTIVE SIGH as the entire floor beneath the pulp GIVES WAY. Dropping down below and taking... Boris Maelev down with it. Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor above comes CRASHING down in a controlled detonation. Giving birth to a ton of dust and debris. Maelev rides the wave, landing in the top of it all, tryi to comprehend where he is and how he got there.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ST. PATRICK’S - DAY A DUST CLOUD MUSHROOMS up from the crypt and out into the space. Mourners stumble back; security stumble forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maelev sitting there, sees a SHAPE emerge from the dust. climbs up the rubble toward him. Salt. She stops above him, offers her hand. As he takes it, she pulls him up, then -- Flings him down off the rubble. She follows, kicks him in the ribs as he tries to stand. CRACK. She hauls him up and brutally backhands him. Blood ropes from his mouth as his head snaps back.  59. And as it occurs to us she may be trying to kill him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
