dialogues.text: The axis of the three dust-choked tunnels. Secret Service Agents, ESU cops and Peabody haul ass this way. Continue with them as they enter the...

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL CRYPT
dialogues.text: Their flashlights run bore holes through the dust. Find t FIGURES: one prone on the ground, the other dropping to i knees, hands raised like a supplicant. As it lays out fla on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Don’t move! They rush up to where Salt lies face-down, limbs outstret beside Maelev. Peabody, kicks Salt’s legs further apart, sets his knee down in the middle of her back. As he cuffs her...

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: You decided to go quietly?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Don’t want to give you the satisfaction. Agent two shoves her face into the rubble, holds it there

dialogues.speaker: AGENT TWO
dialogues.text: Mouth shut. One of the ESU COPS has been checking Maelev. It isn’t go

dialogues.speaker: ESU COP
dialogues.text: (into radio) Get a medical team down here! Peabody leaves Salt to the Agents, scoots over to check Maelev’s throat for a pulse.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Christ, he’s dead. And as the agents start digging their fists into Salt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINE ONE taking off from the middle of 5th Avenue. It’s a mess as the police push back the crowds. The secre service try to sort out world leaders. Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: EAST TRANSEPT
dialogues.text: A KNOT OF AGENTS hustle Salt (hands CUFFED behind her bac out the door. Peabody and now Winter with them. They lead her toward a building across the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a long lens, the REPORTER’S VOICE heard over it.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Preliminary reports identify the assailant as one Evelyn Salt. And this seems unbelievable, folks, but she’s also been identified as a CIA officer. Again, Russian President Maelev is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open from outside and Salt is frog-marched in surrounded by the agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt, Winter, Peabody and the three Secret Service Agents have transport-custody. They’re on their way up, the butt lit for the 35th and top floor.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Winter. Listen to me. Please. He doesn’t look at her.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had to do it. Or they would have killed Mike. The second Zykov IDed me as Chenkov I knew they had Mike. I knew I had to follow this through to the end. There was nothing I could do.  61.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: You want to shut up, or should I have you gagged? Salt tries to catch Winter’s eye, but he won’t look over. DING! The elevator door opens and she’s hauled out into..

dialogues.speaker: 35TH FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: She’s led down the hall. Peabody grim. Winter quite angry Step - step - step - step - until...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I am not Chenkov. And Winter loses it, grabs her, jams her up against the w

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Then who is, Evelyn?! Who the hell is!? The transport agents trying to get between them. Winter looks like he wants to rip her head off.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were my number two! I trusted you! You goddamn traitor! Winter fighting to get at her. Salt regarding him. Agents struggling to lock this situation down.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (spit flying) You piece of shit! He tries to hit her. Salt twists away -- -- And for just a FLASH, we see Salt’s hands up under an agent’s jacket. It’s just for an instant and hardly notic in the huge pushing and shoving. And then Peabody manages to jerk Winter back. They’re apa And Salt, calm, level, blinks and...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I am not Chenkov.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Maelev’s dead. Enough of this crap.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Maelev’s not dead.  62. Everyone is staring at her now. She’s nuts. But she holds Winter’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: Get her to the roof. The agents move. Again a FLASH - behind her back - as Sal just manages to get a HANDCUFF KEY into the cuff lock.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Winter) Get a grip or stay behind. Winter nods he’s okay. As they follow to a door marked RO ACCESS. Transport Agent One opens it.

dialogues.speaker: ROOF ACCESS STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: A flight, a landing, a flight, and a door. The throb of a helicopter can be heard as they start up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: You’ll see. This is just the start of something.

dialogues.speaker: PEABODY
dialogues.text: We get on that helicopter, I’m going to have your mouth taped shut.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: It’s just the start. Salt’s eyes on the feet of Transport Agent One ahead of h The softest click and -- Salt reaches, the cuff dangling her right wrist -- She jerks his leg out from under him. And even before he hits the concrete landing like a sack of potatoes -- She rears back, kicks Transport Agent Two square in the chest. He stumbles back into Winter and as they both fall down the steel stairs -- -- And Transport Agent Three and Peabody draw their guns. Salt uses the hand rail as a launch to deliver a high sci kick to Transport Agent Three’s head. He falls against Peabody sending Peabody’s first SHOT wide. Salt hits the landing, grabs the GUN from the hand of the unsteadily rising Transport Agent One and turns the corne Peabody's SECOND SHOT blows a hole in the wall just where used to be.  63. Peabody steps over Transport Agent Three, hits the landin and is about to fire again, when he has to pull his shot -- as Winter sprints past, chasing as Salt bangs through roof bulkhead door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEDERAL HELICOPTER just about to land, rotorwash whippi the roof. They see Salt on the move. The SNIPER on board grabs his rifle as... Salt sprints for the far edge of the roof. The copter dips its nose and moves after her. Winter stops to take deadly aim. Salt nears the roof edge where TWO STEEL ARMS are swung o and over, the CABLES of a window washing rig hanging down Winter FIRING at Salt! Salt fires into the CLUTCH-BRAKE holding the cables -- And she JUMPS. Out into thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she FALLS a story and LANDS on one end of the WINDOW WASHING PLATFORM just as... It begins a near FREE-FALL down the side of the building, friction of the pulleys slowing it ever so slightly. Salt struggles to get to the end of the rig as it races downward. A full fifteen stories until ... She hits the hand brake jerking the rig to a sudden halt FLATTENING Salt to the deck. And simultaneously SNAPPING the cable on one side. As the rig swings vertical, Salt goes sliding down, scrap for a handhold. Whump! She catches one.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: A MAN at his desk can’t believe what he’s looking at as S pulls up, gets a foothold on the end of the frame.  64.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Reacting as the Federal Helicopter ROARS around the corne SNIPER out on one of the skids. Into his headset...

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: I got a clean shot, please advice.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Take it. Salt turns her face away; she FIRES directly into the win in front of her. BOOM! BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man at his desk diving for cover as he’s showered in glass and -- She’s in! As she rumbles out the door...

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The PEOPLE who work there reacting as Salt races down a l central corridor -- Toward the light from the windows at the end. Raising the gun and -- FIRING ahead at the coming window. Shattering it and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt explodes through the glass -- a figure in thin air. The shards of GLASS REFLECT pieces of her. CHILDREN sitting as the sides of their heads are shaved. The VICIOUS BACKHAND of a Russian Speznatz. ARMS STRAINING in the Iron Cross position on the gym ring COLLAPSING under the weight of the heavy marching pack. KISSING the ring. The BAMBOO SWITCH coming down. Over and over until --  65.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (IN MID AIR LEAP)
dialogues.text: Hits down hard on the rooftop of the adjacent building, t and rolls to her feet. She sprints for the roof access doors, smashes through th Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children all in bed. Seven filled, one empty. FOOTSTE in the dark. Zykov and young Chenkov cross the enormous room. Chenkov’s face bandaged. Only the eyes show. Their breath is visible in the cold.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: (softly) Ignore all else, it is human nature that rules the world. It is human nature that must be guarded against. (she nods) And what else?

dialogues.speaker: CHENKOV
dialogues.text: Freedom. The only sin is freedom.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Yes. Why?

dialogues.speaker: CHENKOV
dialogues.text: In freedom we forget our loyalty. They reach the bed. The girl climbs in, under the cover. Zykov considers her a beat, then holds out his hand. She leans forward, kisses his gold ring.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Wish for it, long for it, and forever be true to it. Zykov walks away. The girl lays on her back staring up at the ceiling. Sad little Shnaider watches her from the next bed.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Chenkov? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: CHENKOV
dialogues.text: I’m going home tomorrow, Shnaider.  66.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Home? To Grozny?

dialogues.speaker: CHENKOV
dialogues.text: My home is in Harrisburg Pennsylvania. My favorite place there is the McDonald’s on Front Street because it’s near the river. (looks over sadly) I won’t want to go anymore because my mother and father are dead. Shnaider considers this, not especially surprised. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Will you miss me, Chenkov?

dialogues.speaker: CHENKOV
dialogues.text: My name... is Evelyn Salt. She turns to look back at the ceiling. And as the two of them lay there in the dark and the cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR unwraps little Chenkov’s face. Zykov standing across from her. We’re on him as the last of the bandages come off. He smiles and we reveal: Little 12-year-old Salt. Face still bruised and puffy fro her ‘accident’, but we certainly recognize the face we've come to know. The doctor holds up a mirror. She looks at herself, frowns, then pushes it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zykov stands with little Salt, alone.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Remember your training. You will not hear from us again. You must remember how your life is to go. Which college you need to attend --

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SALT
dialogues.text: Yale University.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Where you need to work.  67.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SALT
dialogues.text: The Central Intelligence Agency.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Who you need to trust.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SALT
dialogues.text: No one. A still moment. Zykov clocks the pensiveness about her.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SALT
dialogues.text: What if I fail? What if the family see I am not Evelyn Salt?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Your aunt barely knows you. It will be as planned. Remember, this is your first assignment. If you can’t do this, you can’t do any of it. A knock on the door, a HOSPITAL ADMINISTRATOR leans in.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: <They want her.>

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: <Send them.> (to Chenkov) The only thing to fear is that which you love. Zykov turns, starts out.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SALT
dialogues.text: Wait. He pauses. Despairing, she looks at his ring. All she’s ever known. Zykov holds it out, pleased as she kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: One day, I will see you again. And he’s out the door. She stands there alone for several beats. Mastering herself. Shoving everything down inside. The door opens and MARTIN CRENSHAW enters.  68.

dialogues.speaker: CRENSHAW
dialogues.text: Hello, Evelyn. I’m Martin Crenshaw from the US Embassy. We’re so sorry about your parent’s accident. She’s convincingly teary-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SALT
dialogues.text: Please, I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: WOLF BLITZER
dialogues.text: On a little LED TV SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: WOLF BLITZER
dialogues.text: (on TV) ..-harsh words for America from Alexi Barisovsky immediately after his swearing in ceremony at the Kremlin. A shot of the fiery BARISOVSKY speaking outside the Kreml And then -- RIOTING in the streets of Moscow. WOLF BLITZER (CONT’D) As anti-US rioting continues into the night in the area around the American Embassy.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Watching. She’s in the back of a TAXI. The screen mounted on the back of passenger side seat. ON SCREEN: a coffin raised from an airport tarmac on a scissor-lift, then carried into the main cabin of Russia' version of Air Force One. WOLF BLITZER (CONT’D) Meanwhile, the body of slain Russian President Maelev is already on its way back to Russia just two hours after his assassination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s bleak as Salt gets out of a TAXI at a salvage yard/s metal clearing house near the Fresh Kills Landfill. A TRA CAN FIRE burns, ACETYLENE TORCHES burn. At water’s edge a further out, DERELICT BOATS AND SHIPS of every size.  69. And walking toward her: the man we know as Oleg Zykov.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Privyet, Comrade Chenkov.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Privyet, Comrade Zykov. She stops before him, smiles. Thrilled to see him.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I saw you, in Washington, I almost ran to you. I didn’t think I would ever see you again.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: And still you remained faithful? In your heart?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: In my soul. In my very soul. He holds out his ring with its gold star on a red enamel background. Salt leans, kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: When you escaped today I thought, even I could not have hoped for so much. You are my greatest creation. He looks her over with unabashed admiration, puts his han on her hips. She grins, enjoying his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You trained me well. In many things. He embraces her, pulls back as he feels ‘something’.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: What is this? She draws the agent’s gun, shows him.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: May I? The slightest hesitation, but she hands him the gun. As h looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: What you said in Washington, is it true? That you have cancer?  70.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Anaplastic cancer of the thyroid. She grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: (nods ) I have six months, maybe less. And I’ve never even been to Chernobyl. He grins at her nonetheless. She grins back.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: But Zykov gives cancer; he doesn’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: I’m not dead yet... This way. They walk toward the shore. He doesn’t offer back the gun A little MOTORBOAT waits. A MAN aboard.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Twenty-two years. You must have thought I would never call on you.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: It would have been a pity. They reach the decrepit dock, the motorboat and BASAYEV, striking looking man in his mid-20s, a CROWN OF THORNS tattooed across his forehead. He offers his hand to Salt to board. She sees the Cyrilli writing across his knuckles, reads it -- his name.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vasia. He nods in acknowledgement. Then she gets on without his help, sits. As he assists Zykov, she sees his other hand, counts the little SKULLS TATTOOED to the tops of the fing

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eight kills.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: <When you live with wolves, you howl like one.>  71. As he kicks away from the docks, revs the outboard...

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Basayev) My work did not end entirely the day the letters U-S-S-R ceased to mean anything. Salt considers Basayev a beat. What is he exactly? As they head out across the water.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For my whole life I prepared for one thing only. War with the West. And the West prepared for me. We were worthy adversaries.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Treating your adversary with respect gives him an advantage he does not deserve. That’s what you taught us.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: That was before I was forgotten. Not all of us ran oil companies or bought soccer teams after the fall. Some of us had nothing. They said it was time to stop dividing the world into black and white. So now I sit in the FSB building in Moscow. With a beach and a coconut tree on the wall. Worrying about the Chechnens and defectors in London. I thought I had nothing left but my secrets.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Secrets like me.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Like you. My agents are the last children of the cold war. My great asset. I used them to rebuild. (a beat) And what has become of the two great Cold War nations? Without each other we are purposeless, lost. Fighting the Iraqis, blackmailing the Ukrainians. While the Chinese and India take over. Where is our honor? Basayev eases off the throttle as they near a RUSTED BARG She sees a man wearing a shoulder holster waiting for the deck. Then, back to Zykov.  72.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: So what will we do? What is our mission now?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Tabula rasa. A clean slate. The Soviets and the Americans will reach their intertwined destinies and the world will be cleansed as a result. He has something in mind and it sounds dangerous and big.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Soon you will know... But first things first as they say. Basayev catches the side of the barge, holds the motorboa steady as Salt and Zykov climb the rusty welded ladder ru A tetanus shot waiting to happen.

dialogues.speaker: DECK
dialogues.text: Joined by Basayev, they cross to a large open HATCH. A du glow of light below. Seems a shit direction to be travell

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: What’s down there?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Well, it occurs to me that perhaps you've changed. And I need to be sure you have not.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I proved myself at St. Patrick’s. Wouldn’t you say?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: You did well, but what I have in mind is too important not to be sure. He raises his eyebrows. Salt shrugs, heads down into...

dialogues.speaker: THE BOWELS
dialogues.text: Skirts the standing water as she heads toward the light. A couple of car battery WORKLIGHTS have been set up. FIVE heavy RUSSIAN MOBSTERS here. Standing at the edge of a TA Two of them armed with ASSAULT RIFLES.  73. Salt is followed by Basayev and Zykov. Finally she has th angle to see down inside:

dialogues.speaker: THE TANK
dialogues.text: Standing in the bottom -- Her husband MIKE. His ankle chained to a fitting on the tank floor. As he looks up...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Dead still. Whatever the thought is that’s screaming thro her brain is hers and hers alone to know.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOWELS
dialogues.text: Zykov steps up beside Salt.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're surprised? Still looking at Mike...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: No. I knew that you had him. Zykov studies her in the dim light.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Are you ready to watch him die? Mike locked on her as...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Give me a gun.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: That would be too easy. Zykov nods to the unarmed Russian gangster. He pulls a handle, opening a valve. A rushing sound as WATER POURS rapidly into the tank, gus round Mike's feet, covering the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Either way. It doesn’t matter to me.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Doesn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: No.  74. Mike grim, never takes his eyes off Salt.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: The truth is... The water now gushing around Mike’s knees. Coming up fast

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is the privilege of those who fear love to murder those who do not. Zykov smiles down at Mike, addresses him as he strokes Sa cheek with the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She hears me, she recognizes me, she is mine, a possession for all time. The water at Mike’s waist.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think you ever had her? You were merely a plaything. A surrogate for her loneliness. Zykov truly a nasty, sinister piece of work. He runs his hand casually down her body.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She has always been mine. Her mouth? Her tongue? I taught her to use them, I taught her to love. What you felt was me. As Zykov leans in to kiss Salt’s throat, it gives Mike a chance to glance up above, then back at her. The water at his chest.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She is the monster I created. As Zykov drills Mike with a look, Salt has a moment to gl above where Mike tried to direct her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught in a flash of light: a SPIDER sitting in a LARGE W

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Looks back down at...  75.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The water up just under his chin. The slightest flare in eyes. He’s trying to tell her something.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Neutral. At least she appears so as Zykov watches her. We don’t know if the message has been passed or not.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: The waters creeps up Mike’s cheeks. He tilts his head bac but still keeps his eyes on her. Salt stares back. One last moment before the water swallo him up. At a nod from Zykov, the gangster pulls the handle, shutt off the water. Just a few inches above Mike’s upturned fa A frozen beat before bubbles erupt from Mike’s mouth and in sudden, tortured bursts. And Salt witnesses every moment. A beholder. And Zykov watches her as... Mike’s hands break the surface as he flails. Finally a la silent scream, his mouth dark and wide. Until Death claim him. And his body settles away into the murk below. Salt turns, looks frankly to Zykov. Then: kisses Zykov on the mouth. Even Basayev raises an eyebrow. Salt pulls bac

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV
dialogues.text: Satisfied. He takes her arm, starts walking her back the other way.

dialogues.speaker: ZYKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Russians are at the abyss. Now for the Americans. Tonight they meet at Camp David The President, his cabinet, the Joint Chiefs and NATO representatives. We will be there as well. Helping them generate their reply to the Russian sabre rattling. (a beat) You’1l be brought in by David Cerny, a Czech Colonel, the NATO liaison.  76.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: He’s one of us? Zykov smiles at a private joke, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a CESSNA CITATION touches down, taxis over to a hangar An official looking SEDAN waiting as...

dialogues.speaker: THE CESSNA
dialogues.text: Turns, taxis into the HANGAR. DAVID CERNY gets out of the sedan. In his blue NATO UNIFO He steps up, watches as the Cessna’s door is opened. And stepping off the plane... a MAN. In the blue uniform of a NATO MAJOR. He SALUTES. Cerny returns the gesture...

dialogues.speaker: CERNY
dialogues.text: Major Vicek. Good to see you again. This way. MOVE WITH Vicek as Cerny leads him to the car. And as we realize we are looking at Salt as a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cerny behind the wheel. Salt/Vicek beside him as they dri

dialogues.speaker: CERNY
dialogues.text: Do you remember me? Chenkov. She studies him. Not yet. He gives her a hint.

dialogues.speaker: CERNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you miss me? As she recognizes those palest BLUE EYES.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Shnaider. Cerny/Shnaider smiles, nods. Salt can’t help but LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You finally stopped crying. (he nods; pleased) How long have you been here?  77.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER/CERNY
dialogues.text: I left Russia one year after you. To Prague. I’ve been the NATO liaison to the White House for three years.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Zykov thought of everything. (assumes an accent) I am NATO Major Jiri Vicek from Karlovy Vary. He hands her Vicek’s CREDENTIALS and wallet. Then a set o ARCHITECTURAL SCHEMATICS clearly marked as Camp David. Shnaider flips a page to: a SIDE VIEW. An ELEVATOR SHAFT running deep below Camp David to a SUBTERRANEAN CHAMBER below. Shnaider taps his finger on it.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: That’s where the President needs to be.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: We are not the primary. We are secondary, diversionary. And as they continue and the windshield wipers THWAK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUSSIAN FLAG-DRAPED COFFIN rests in the plane’s confere room. Two members of the SECURITY DETAIL sit guard.

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER VOICE
dialogues.text: <We are making the final descent on Vnukovo Airport. Please fasten your seatbelts.> The security detail boys react at a muffled coffin sound. Another. They exchange looks like: “Did you hear that?” Suddenly, a POUNDING from INSIDE the coffin. They unlatch their seat belts, jump up at a muffled shout And they’re unlatching, pulling open the lid to reveal: A bewildered, but very alive President Maelev.  78.

dialogues.speaker: BORIS MAELEV
dialogues.text: <What the fuck happened to me?!> They don’t have an answer as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pass a SIGN: Naval Research Facility -- -- Shnaider turns left down a short road, stops behind several other OFFICIAL looking CARS waiting to pass throu MARINE CHECKPOINT. GUARD TOWERS loom over a DOUBLE-GATE “mantrap” system. Shnaider looks to Salt.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Welcome to Camp David, Major Vicek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President’s MIL AIDE sits stock still against the wal HEAVY BRIEFCASE rests in his lap. The room fully equipped with all the same sat-com and teleconference technology as the White House. The President is deep in conversation with his CHIEF OF STAFF, National Security Advisor MILLER and SEC DEF CHALM The President flips through a set of SATELLITE THERMAL IMAGING as Miller points out...

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: These are temperature-drops in mobile missile units across the Kaliningrad Oblast and in southern Baikal.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: What exactly does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: SEC DEF CHALMERS
dialogues.text: It means Barisovsky has the Russians fueling their rockets. We assume you don’t gas up unless you’re getting ready to go. As it settles on the President a beat, the First Lady ste up. She’s very aware she’s interrupting something heavy.  79.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LADY
dialogues.text: I’m going to the screening room for a movie. Okay? He squeezes her hand, nods. A beat between them and she g

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Even if they’re posturing, the only meaningful response will be our own ICBM’s being fueled. The Russians will read it and notice will be served.

dialogues.speaker: SEC DEF CHALMERS
dialogues.text: We should put some planes in the air, surface move a submarine or two and open some silo doors. That and go from Defcon 4 to Defcon 3. At least at our forward bases.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: (disbelief) This was supposed to be a Russian American fraternal summit, not a crises meeting to go to Defcon 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate ahead of the sedan closed, the gate behind closi Shnaider hands a MARINE GUARD on his side his NATO ID.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Sergeant. Salt hands hers to a GUARD on her side. As TWO OTHERS loo under the car with mirrors...

dialogues.speaker: GUARD FIVE
dialogues.text: Could you pop the trunk, Sir? He reaches, pops it. The Sergeant hands him back his ID.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: You think the Redskins have a chance at the playoffs?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Nice try.  80. Salt frowns, tenses. Are they made?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE SERGEANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know you NATO folks only care about soccer, Sir. Shnaider smiles. As the Sergeant waves the gate open...

dialogues.speaker: SEDAN
dialogues.text: They drive through. Past a FIRE STATION. Past a landing zone where a floodlit MARINE ONE sits. And past a trench-coated SECRET SERVICE AGENT who directs them into a SMALL PARKING LOT. Past the President’s LIMO and SECURITY MOTORCADE VEHICLES Shnaider parks facing Marine One. He looks at it through windshield a beat, then turns the steering wheel, almost through making an adjustment. As they exit, we hold on the dash where a discreet AMBER LIGHT starts to blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military BRASS and SUITS going through the Secret Service CHECKPOINT at the Social Center Entrance. (The buildings here are lodge style, not official looking at all). As Salt and Shnaider are directed that way, he points out another lodge-style BUILDING beyond.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Briefing center. The president’s in there. They show their visitor’s badges to the SECRET SERVICE AG at the doors. They’re checked and waved through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIRE burns. Refreshments are served. Shnaider points ou HAYES who is coming toward them. Low to Salt:

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Bill Hayes, Special Assistant to the President. You don’t know him.  81. As Hayes steps up, shakes Shnaider’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: Colonel Cerny, good to see you. He turns to Salt, who also shakes. And introduces herself a well modulated ‘male’ voice.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Major Vicek.

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: Pleased. (to Shnaider) You’1l have two minutes to preview NATO’s point of view before the main meeting starts.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: About five minutes -- Excuse me. He turns as his earpiece chirps to life. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: HAYES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into his NexTel) Got him. Thirty seconds. He steps to the buffet table, taps a MAN on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HAYES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re asking for you. The man turns. It’s Winter! As Hayes leads them past, he almost walks into Salt.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Doesn’t recognize him/her at all. As Salt watches him exi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter sits across from the President.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
dialogues.text: You’re on the CIA's Russia Desk, Mr. Winter, what's your assessment?  82.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Screw assessments. Our intel says a Russian Agent killed Maelev. What the hell are they up to?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: I think Barisovsky knows we weren’t behind the hit on Maelev. But he’s a hard-liner; he needs to consolidate power right now. Especially if Maelev’s assassination was in reality a coup-d’etat. A STAFFER interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER
dialogues.text: We have the footage ready, Sir. The President nods. They turn to the big video screen.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
dialogues.text: (to Winter) From your offices yesterday. ON SCREEN: Hallway security camera footage as: Bottoms an the security officer reacting to the alarm. Zykov kick his bladed toe into the security officer’s thi dropping him and -- Getting the steel line garrote around Bottoms’ throat. The security officer reaches for his gun until Zykov ‘kic the blade up through his throat.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Good god... Zykov releases Bottoms, takes the security officer’s 9mm ID and calmly exits frame.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF
dialogues.text: What do you have on him?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Not much. Oleg Zykov... He passes out files.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mid-level bureaucrat. Works in Moscow at the FSB headquarters. In the Domestic Counter Terrorism Unit.  83.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: And the CIA agent who killed Maelev? What do you have on her?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Evelyn Salt. Her history, spotless. Her record, exemplary. The only thing that raises a red flag, in hindsight, is her parents died in the Soviet Union.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Car accident. 1988. They were teachers at the US Embassy. For the American children of the staff. Their daughter, Salt, was badly hurt in the crash, but she survived. As they consider this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayes gives Shnaider and Salt the high sign. They’re up. they follow him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayes leads the way as they cross the ground from the soc center to the briefing center. A little behind Salt, Shnaider reaches in his jacket, pul out his CAR KEYS. He presses a button on the remote then -- Sweeps Salt down to the ground as...

dialogues.speaker: THE NATO SEDAN
dialogues.text: EXPLODES! With extreeeeeeme prejudice. A pulsing surge of fury radiating out from it. On one side: a FLEET OF CARS lift off their wheels, are slammed back, windshields IMPLODING.  84. On the other side: Marine One is enveloped in a FIREBALL KNOCKED to its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hayes is blown off his feet like a rag doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter, the President, SecDef Chalmers and NSA Miller rea as the windows BLOW OUT! The Mil Aide with the briefcase is knocked off his chair windows on either side of him blow out.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Still on the ground. She looks up in time to see:

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE
dialogues.text: EXPLODING! All 88 feet of it. Much of the force directs upwards. The ROTOR HUB and DRIVE SHAFT hurtle PAST CAMERA BURNING DIESEL and FLAMING WRECKAGE start to rain down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shnaider to his feet as a SECRET SERVICE AGENT rushes pas He CLOTHESLINES him, relieves him of his UZI and his SIG- Sauer which he tosses to Salt. As she looks to the wreckage of Marine One...

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: (a grin) I should have mentioned that. (now urgent) They’1l move the president to the bunker. (pointing) That way for you, this way for me. We take out as many agents as we can. A beat and Shnaider dashes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SECRET SERVICE AGENTS, including JENKS (the Agent on President), haul ass in. They each grab the President by arm, start to hustle him out.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: (radio) Geronimo is SOP to the LBOC!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haul the President through the door and outside. Win and Miller follow, along with Chalmers who assists the Mi Aide. He grips his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: Marine One is down. Protocol is evacuation to the bunker! The President fights them to a stop. The darkness lit by burning fuel which has even set the roof of the Social Ce on fire.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Where’s my wife?! Someone locate my wife!

dialogues.speaker: JENKS
dialogues.text: Her detail is looking after her, sir. Now move. Jenks physically compels him along. They’1ll protect him himself if they have to.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: In the shadows, watching them pass, turning at GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An 18-YEAR-OLD MARINE FIRING his rifle into the night. Th gate Sergeant grabbing him by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE SERGEANT
dialogues.text: What are you shooting at?!  86. He doesn’t answer, obviously doesn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shnaider, pretending to stagger, with his jacket in his h as SEVEN SECRET SERVICE AGENTS motor toward him on their to the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: There are men that way! Coming over the fence! As they turn... Shnaider lets the UZI RIP. Through his jacket. As all sev agents go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six-member CAT TEAM (counter assault) roll out. Gas masks, body armor, tooled up to the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President hustled along. All others can keep up or di as far as the Secret Service are concerned.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: In the trees, shadowing the President. She pauses as TWO AGENTS rumble past, then reacts to more GUNFIRE, SCREAMS behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: He’s just killed another three agents. As he turns, he sees Salt standing there. He gives her a curious look, then frowns. Something’s not right. She’s pointing the Sig-Sauer at him.

dialogues.speaker: SHNAIDER
dialogues.text: Chenkov...  87.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: My name is Salt. Her eyes flaring as BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Shnaider’s headed for the green green grass of home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MORE AGENTS here. The CAT team arriving as Jenks le up the President, Winter, Miller, Chalmers and the Mil Ai

dialogues.speaker: AGENT AT DOOR
dialogues.text: First Lady is en route. We got about ten people inside.

dialogues.speaker: JENKS
dialogues.text: (to CAT leader) The first lady and her party. No one else gets in. Defend this position. As the CAT leader nods, Jenks takes everyone else inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOLF CART bouncing along. The three agents aboard, two them sandwiching the First Lady in the back. As they follow the cart path, all guns suddenly aimed at FIGURE ahead. Illuminated by the cart’s headlights:

dialogues.speaker: A NATO MAJOR
dialogues.text: Jiri Vicek. Hands raised. BLOOD all over ‘his’ face.

dialogues.speaker: PRIMARY AGENT
dialogues.text: Hold your fire. That’s NATO.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LADY
dialogues.text: God, look at him. Stop! They pull up. The blood is probably Shnaider’s.

dialogues.speaker: SALT/MAJOR VICEK
dialogues.text: (best Czech accent) Explosion...

dialogues.speaker: PRIMARY AGENT
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward of the entry facing out. The CAT team radios blea

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ONE
dialogues.text: I have Cherokee inbound to Aspen. They watch as the bouncing headlight appears. They wave t in. As the Agents, the First Lady and Salt disembark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the other Camp David STAFF are here with their Se Service escorts. The ELEVATOR doors open. The President, Winter, Chalmers Miller, the Mil Aide and Jenks step out. As all eyes turn to the President.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Everyone stay safe and we will figure this out. That said he’s hustled down a corridor where another ELEV waits, guarded by two more AGENTS. Jenks punches in a cod As the elevator doors open to receive them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On its way down with the First Lady, Salt and the agents. The Primary Agent listens over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: PRIMARY AGENT
dialogues.text: The President is safe, Ma’am. He’s on his way down to the lower bunker.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LADY
dialogues.text: Let him know I’m okay. They stop. The doors ping open.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER BUNKER ENTRY
dialogues.text: As the First Lady greets the staff there... SALT cruises past the corridor, sees the guards outside t second elevator. Cruises on and enters... THE MEN’S ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the LBOC elevator. As the doors open, Winter and t President and his party step out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt pulls her way in from the men’s room. Back pressed t the wall, she replaces the grill behind her. A straight d As she quickly ‘back-scoots’ down the shaft toward the si shafts and VENT FANS spinning below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President, and the others step through the bunker’s MASSIVE DOOR - 10 feet high and 5 feet thick. Once everyo is through... Agent Jenks hits a panel button: the door starts closing. He looks to TWO OF HIS AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: Take this position. As Jenks takes the group further into the bunker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vertical now, Salt moving along quietly. It isn’t that difficult over the mechanics of the closing bunker door. Ahead the duct reaches its end point (at the bunker wall) She looks down through a vent, sees the backs of the two guard secret service agents below.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER PORTAL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The Secret Service Agents standing sentry as the door continues to close behind them. Unaware as the vent screen lifts away behind and above th All their focus ahead, as Salt uncoils down from the shaf hangs there above. Still, until -- She unleashes a KICK into the side of the first agent’s h As he drops and -- -- The second agent wheels --  90. Salt drops, lands low. Comes up under his chin. As he staggers back -- -- The door continues to close beyond. Salt chops at his arm, knocks away his gun. As she glances to the door -- he catches her with a hard right, moves to follow. She ducks, comes up with a left-right-left and finishes w a wicked elbow across his temple. As he drops -- Salt scoops his gun, makes a HARD DASH for the door which nearly closed and -- -- She dives through and into...

dialogues.speaker: THE BUNKER ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Tucking and rolling like the gymnast she once was. Ending a crouch, she looks back as the door shuts with finality. Salt wipes at her face, tears off what remains of her fac prothesis after getting punched. Looking more like her ol self again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ringed with video screens: some clear, some cycling throu surveillance views, some showing CNN and other news servi All playing silently. A team of THREE TECHS. One side of the room is a 5x12 foot reinforced GLASS WIND looking out at another larger CONFERENCE ROOM beyond. Thi room is empty. The President, Agent Jenks, Winter and all the others ent through a HEAVY OPEN DOOR on the right.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD TECH
dialogues.text: We have the Director Medford up. On one screen: CIA DIRECTOR MEDFORD at Langley. The President looks to a Tech who switches on the two-way.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: What the situation, Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MEDFORD
dialogues.text: What’s the situation there?! We’re hearing all sorts of wild reports.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: I’m fine. We’re down in the bunker. What’s going on with the Russians?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MEDFORD
dialogues.text: We're not sure. Something strange.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Dan, it’s Ted Winter. Strange how? Director Medford can obviously see him on his end.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MEDFORD
dialogues.text: Everything's in flux, but our intel as of five minutes ago says that Maelev’s successor Barisovsky is no longer in power.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: What? How is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MEDFORD
dialogues.text: All we know is chain of command to him has been broken off.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: There may have been a coup. (to President) It would be prudent to look at the SIOP options, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Do you think we’ve reached that point, Challie?

dialogues.speaker: SEC DEF CHALMERS
dialogues.text: I think all our options need to be on the table. We need to be ready. The President nods, looks to the Mil Aide who steps up. A he turns the combination on the briefcase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashy high tech room. Right now the screens flooded wi information on Russia. A PHONE set by itself starts to RI A 3-STAR GENERAL answers: it can only be one person.

dialogues.speaker: 3-STAR
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIG-Sauer leading the way, Salt makes her way along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter watches anxiously as the President and the Mil Aid both on separate phones, both in the middle of reading co off of cards.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT MIL AIDE
dialogues.text: ...Z-evergreen-9-X-7-Memphis-— ...Trinidad-7-J-S-A-copper . T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3-STAR’S VOICE (over phone) Authentication codes confirmed. The briefcase has been attached by a high speed cable to control panel. The president sets his palm down on the briefcase’s built-in BIOMETRIC SCANNER. As it read his fingerprints, flashes identity confirmed -- --The op center screens fill with similar information as those at the Pentagon. But suddenly another screen is more interesting.

dialogues.speaker: TECH THREE
dialogues.text: Look at this. The control tech has stopped the scroll at a particular security camera image: The two secret service agents now conscious outside the closed portal door. Agent Jenks steps over, switches to an IMAGE of another A in a hallway. We see him up close, face forward. Standing there. On guard.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: (into radio) Simmons, what do you got out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Simmons standing stock still. Just around the corne few feet ahead of him (out of camera range), Salt points gun straight at his head. She looks to his radio, nods.  93.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SIMMONS
dialogues.text: (into radio) I’m all clear. Salt motions him to step toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Agent Jenks reacts.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: (to room) Something’s wrong. He just said the distress words. On screen: Agent Simmons steps forward out of sight. Agent Jenks switches camera views to the other hallway. W see Salt clock Simmons across the head with the barrel of gun. Down he goes.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Who the hell is she?

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: That’s a NATO uniform. A major.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: That’s Evelyn Salt. She killed Maelev. She’s the Russian. Another SCREEN shows Salt advancing down a hall.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: She’s coming this way. Agent Jenks and his other two agents all point their guns the door. Agent Jenks has an UZI on a sling, his SIG-SAUE still holstered. AGENT JENKS (CONT’D) (to Tech Three) Close that door. Tech Three hits a switch. Agent Jenks glances to the security camera view of the hallway outside the door. Emp AGENT JENKS (CONT’D) (into radio) I need every agent in the facility to the ops center. We are breached. At least one intruder in a NATO uniform.  94. And the HEAVY DOOR slides into place, seats and seals its with a hermetic whoosh. No sooner done then... The security cam shows Salt arrive at the closed door, th SIG-SAUER in one hand, Simmons’ Uzi in the other.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Give me your pistol; I’m qualified on it.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: No. Only the Secret Service possess firearms in the President’s vicinity. Winter stepping up alongside Agent Jenks.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Screw protocol! There’s an enemy agent out here! Tough minded Jenks shakes his head. All eyes on the scree as Salt looks for a way to open the door. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JENKS
dialogues.text: Protocol is protocol. Without warning, Winter grabs the handle of Jenks’ SIG-Sa and turns it inward (still holstered) and FIRES twice thr Jenks’ chest.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: And dead is dead. As Jenks falls, Winter smoothly intercepts his Uzi, opens fire across the room. RAT-A-TAT. SecDef Chalmers and the two other Secret Service Agents go down as well as the Le and Second Tech. Winter has to move to the side to kill the Mil Aide who h taken cover behind the console.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Hears the muffled sounds of GUNFIRE within.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER BUNKER OPERATIONS CENTER
dialogues.text: Winter swings on Miller, who blinks in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: But... I’m the National Security Advisor.  95. A BURST and he’s no longer employed. Winter steps forward blow away the third tech cowering behind the console. As the President goes for one of the fallen agent’s guns, Winter swings the Uzi practically into his face. The President freezes.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Sit - down. The President does as he’s told.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: My name, Mr. President, is Nikolai Tarkovsky. And I am the last person you will ever meet. SALT — HALLWAY Turning at a set of RUNNING FOOTSTEPS. Salt runs to meet them at the corner. Barrelling into -- -- TWO more AGENTS. A leg sweep on one, DISCHARGING his g into the ceiling as he falls. The heel of her palm up under the chin of the second. A brutal knee drives him back into the wall. She knocks his gun away, wheels to head kick the first ag on the ground. He’s out, but Salt -- -- Catches an elbow in the face from the second agent. Sh comes up under his guard, digs her fists into either side his rib cage and then HEADBUTTS him into unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER BUNKER OPERATIONS CENTER
dialogues.text: The President and Winter react as on screen: the Agent dr unconscious and Salt disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: football) Let’s look at some selective attack options. Russian military, industrial and civilian targets. The President is frightened, but defiant.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Go to hell.  96. As the President moves to stand - WHACK! - Winter pistol whips him across the head. As he falls unconscious. Winter types into the football’s keyboard to access a selective attack option or SAO. And suddenly Salt can be seen through the glass entering CONFERENCE ROOM. She looks in, sees the blood on the glas on the walls. Sees the President clutching his bloody arm But mostly she sees Winter there Uzi in hand.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Ted? Reacting to her voice over the speaker, Winter sees Salt: nose bleeding, a SIG-Sauer in one hand, an UZI in the oth He gives her an odd smile. Scanning the console, he throw switch on the speaker on his side.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: <Privyet, Comrade Chenkov. We are about to set the world on fire.>

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: As Salt stares at him, still tries to understand.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (over speakers) <You don't know how many times I almost confided in you. Almost told you everything. I was the prototype. Comrade Zykov's first born. The rest of you were all modelled after me.> Salt responds in English.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Open the door. Let me in.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Oh, let’s speak in Russian. How I longed for it over the years. To speak my native tongue. (laughs ) You know, I used to go to the Lincoln Memorial. When it was deserted. At one, two in the morning. And I would whisper to him in Russian. (grins) <Privyet, Abraham.>

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: <Let me in.>  97.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) <I think it's better for you to stay out there. There may be more Secret Service Agents to deal with.> She nods, agrees, then suddenly raises the SIG-Sauer and BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! -- she fires three shots in about a sec At Winter. Who just stands there a foot from the glass. He looks at three slugs that should have slammed through head, but are now embedded in the very bullet-proof glass As he looks back to her...

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You told Zykov, didn’t you? About Mike. You told him my loyalty needed to be tested. Winter taps the glass by the bullets with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: Didn’t it? She looks past him to a MONITOR running CNN, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: There’s your answer. Winter sees the report on screen: BORIS MAELEV can be see descending the stairs from the Russian Air Force One. Winter hits the volume. CNN ANCHOR’S VOICE Once again - Boris Maelev, the Russian President is alive. You are watching live footage as he arrives at Moscow’s Vnukovo Airport. Initial reports indicate some form of temporary paralysis... Stunned, Winter looks back to Salt.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Once his doctors run the tests, they may or may not find the toxin of a beetle, Dermestes Vulpinus.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: (realizing) Traitor! You fucking traitor!>  98. Winter flinches at a RATCHET OF GUNFIRE as Salt unloads t Uzi into the glass. In acircle. She grabs a chair from th conference table. SCREAMING, she flings in into the center of the bullet circle. It bounces off.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Made in America, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I’m going to kill you. The computer console BEEPS and the screen lists the SAO’s With Russian TARGET MAPS.

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: (a beat) Excuse us now, we have a launch to initiate. Winter types into the briefcase. Salt can see the target screens through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: At Russia? Doesn’t that make you the traitor?

dialogues.speaker: WINTER
dialogues.text: We are not loyal to mother Russia, Chenkov. We are loyal to Oleg Zykov. She stares a beat as Winter continues to type. Then she focuses beyond, on the inside of the locked HEAV DOOR. Her eyes focus in on the panel control to the right side of it, gauging its placement. Then Salt dashes out.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY OUTSIDE LBOC DOORWAY
dialogues.text: As one of the agents regains consciousness - WHAM! - Salt puts him out again. Rolling him over she pulls FIVE CLIPS from his ammo holst She slaps the first into the Uzi, unloads the entire clip into the wall to the left (from this side) of the door.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER BUNKER OPERATIONS CENTER
dialogues.text: Winter looking over at the surveillance screen as Salt unloads clip number two. Then she looks directly into the screen, aims the SIG-Sauer and off the muzzle flash -- The screen goes black.  99. Winter turns back to what he’s doing. dialogues.text: Me... She looks up, at some fixed spot above and past him. Look about as sad as can be.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (still looking) They killed my husband. And I watched and I did nothing. Because of that goddamn vow I took.

dialogues.text: What? Some KGB vow?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: CIA. Remember? Country, duty, and the greater fucking good. (a painful beat) I guess I’m wired that way.  104.

dialogues.text: Where'd they do it? Where’d they kill Mike? Tell me so I can go after Zykov.

dialogues.text: You know why Mike liked spiders? It was the webs. He knew everything about webs. He even memorized this poem. And taught it to me. (finally looks at him) You want to hear it?

And all that journey down through space, in cool descent and loyal hearted, she spins a ladder to the place from where she started. Thus I, gone forth as spiders do, in spider's web a truth discerning, attach one silken thread to you, for my returning. And despite all his stoic professionalism, Peabody’s hear breaks a little for Salt. She squeezes her eyes shut, mourning, body wracked, but n sound coming out. As she gets control again...

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (CONT'D)
